commitResults.messageTitle: Refactoring by extracting echo as a method to be called for Level-1
Change list to start from 1 instead of 0 for Level-2

commitResults.messageBody:
Implement a simple validation method for marking and unmarking the
list also.

Prevents ArrayIndexOutOfBounds exception, NumberFormatException
and prevent the user from accessing item list numbers that are not
yet created.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add increments: Level-4, A-TextUiTesting and A-CodeQuality
commitResults.messageBody:
* Add support for tracking todo, deadline and event types
* Implement a TaskManager class to manage all types of tasks,
refactor the methods to manage tasks originally in Duke to
TaskManager
* Remove comments in lines 9 and 10 in Duke
* Set up test using the I/O redirection technique

* Add support for handling errors when user gives incorrect inputs
  which includes:
  * Not using the correct keywords
  * Having no description when creating a task
  * Having no time details when creating a task
  * Not having an integer value when marking or unmarking a task
* Add a help message when user does use the correct keywords
* Add custom exceptions to have semantic errors
* Refactor classes into packages for organization of code
* Refactor markTask and unmarkTask in TaskManager to be a single
  method
* MAXTASKCOUNT in TaskManager in all uppercase to adhere to coding
  standards.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add increment: Level-6 * Add support for deleting tasks from the list by changing the   underlying data structure for taskList from an array to an   arraylist
commitResults.messageBody:
* Update all TaskManager methods to work with an arraylist data
  structure instead of an array

commitResults.messageTitle: Add preliminary version of TaskRecorder class
commitResults.messageBody:
This version is a standalone version still in debugging phase.
To be merged with master branch as integration require changes
from branch-Level-6.

Duke is now able to update any changes to the save file.

Specifically, any add, delete, mark or unmark command will be saved.
The data can then be retrieved the next name Duke boots up.

commitResults.messageTitle: Extract code that gets the command word into a method

commitResults.messageBody: To adhere to variable naming coding standards

commitResults.messageTitle: Remove magic number by introducing variables
commitResults.messageBody: To avoid magic number that does not explain the meaning of the number
To adhere to variable naming coding standards

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor code in Duke.java into new class
commitResults.messageBody:
Code related to parsing user inputs and printing messages is
refactored into new class to adhere to OOP coding paradigm.

Code related to parsing user inputs and printing messages are
separate functionalities that are refactored into two classes to
adhere to OOP coding paradigm.

Code related to printing messages are refactored into
UserInterface.java to adhere to OOP coding paradigm.
Give users a way to find a task by searching for a keyword.

commitResults.messageTitle: Extract out commands as separate classes
commitResults.messageBody:
Code related to execute specific commands from users are
refactored into separate classes to adhere to OOP coding paradigm.

commitResults.messageBody:
User guide describes the main functionalities of Duke for new users
to reference.
